meanings.definition: The act of stealing; the wrongful taking and carrying away of the personal goods or property of another.
meanings.sent1: The theft of the purse was reported to the police.
meanings.sent2: He was arrested for theft after taking money from the cash register.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the theft of the audience's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a theft of the spotlight, captivating everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The theft of the diamond necklace left the owner devastated.

meanings.definition: The unauthorized use or possession of someone else's property; larceny.
meanings.sent1: Identity theft can lead to serious financial consequences.
meanings.sent2: The theft of intellectual property is a serious crime in the business world.
meanings.sent3: The theft of the last cookie from the jar caused a playful argument.
meanings.sent4: His charm was a theft of hearts, leaving a trail of broken relationships.
meanings.sent5: The theft of ideas can hinder innovation and progress.
